marketNews.title: S&P500 Prints ATH Amid US GDP Upward Revision
marketNews.content: The S&P500 printed an all-time high in Thursday's (8/28) trading session, rising +0.32% to the 6,502 level, following the upward revision of US GDP data for 2Q25 on the same day. US economic growth in 2Q25 was revised up by the US Bureau of Statistics to +3.3% annualized (vs. 1Q25: -0.5% annualized), higher than the consensus expectation of +3.1% and the initial estimate of +3%. On a weekly basis, the S&P500 index strengthened by +2.07%, the US Dollar Index (DXY) was relatively flat (-0.82%), while the 10-year US government bond yield fell -12 basis points to 4.2% as of Thursday (8/28). This movement followed the statement by Fed Chair Jerome Powell last Friday (8/22) which signaled that the central bank is opening the possibility of a US interest rate cut at the September 2025 meeting in line with increased labor market risks. Following the revision of US economic growth data, the probability of a US interest rate cut at the September 2025 meeting remained stable weekly at ~85% as of Friday (8/29), based on analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool. Amid the rise in the S&P500, the IHSG fell -1.53% to the 7,830 level today, Friday (8/29), in line with negative sentiment from a series of demonstrations since the beginning of this week.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: In the near future, the market awaits the US core Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) index data to be released on Friday (8/29) local time, US labor data release on Friday (9/5) next week, and the US inflation data release on September 11, 2025. These three data points have the potential to influence the Fed's decision on interest rates at the September 16-17, 2025 meeting. Jeff Roach from LPL Financial stated that weaker US labor data could suppress economic growth momentum from the previous quarter, thus opening further opportunities for an interest rate cut.

marketNews.content: "Symbiotic mutualism where Danantara benefits while conglomerates get funding." - ricky2212

tickerNews.title: AADI 1H25: Net Profit -50% YoY, Exceeding Expectations
tickerNews.content: 1. AADI: Adaro Andalan Indonesia recorded a net profit of 233 million US dollars in 2Q25 (+18.7% QoQ, -60% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 1H25 to 429 million US dollars (-50.1% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equates to 56.7% of the 2025F consensus estimate. The quarterly increase in net profit in 2Q25 was due to a revenue increase (+6.1% QoQ), a decrease in operating expenses (-3.4% QoQ), and a reversal of other losses from a loss of 5 million US dollars in 1Q25 to a profit of 28 million US dollars in 2Q25, causing the net profit margin to rise to 18.8% in 2Q25 (vs. 1Q25: 16.8%). Operationally, AADI recorded an operating profit of 292 million US dollars in 2Q25 (+0.9% QoQ, +2.5% YoY), resulting in an operating profit for 1H25 reaching 581 million US dollars (-9.5% YoY) and exceeding expectations (63.7% of the 2025F consensus estimate). The operating profit margin in 2Q25 was recorded at 23.6% (vs. 1Q25: 24.8%, 2Q24: 21.2%). 2. BSSR: Baramulti Suksessarana recorded a net profit of 30 million US dollars in 2Q25 (+54% QoQ, -21% YoY), so the net profit for 1H25 reached 50 million US dollars (-38% YoY). The quarterly increase in net profit in 2Q25 was supported by a revenue increase (+13% QoQ) which was higher than the increase in the cost of revenue (+12% QoQ), causing the gross profit margin to rise to 32.7% (vs. 1Q25: 32.3%) and resulting in a net profit margin expansion to 17.4% (vs. 1Q25: 12.8%). 3. PTRO: Petrosea obtained a term loan facility of up to 2.5 trillion Rupiah from Bank Mandiri (BMRI) with a tenor of 8 years. This facility will be utilized to support capital expenditure and working capital strengthening for business development in the engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) line of business. 4. AMMN: Amman Mineral Internasional Commissioner, Alexander Ramlie, sold approximately 283 million AMMN shares at an average price of 8,075 Rupiah per share on August 26, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.3 trillion Rupiah. After this transaction, Alexander Ramlie's ownership in AMMN decreased from 0.536% to 0.145%. 5. HRTA: Hartadinata Abadi announced a precious metal purchase and sale cooperation with a subsidiary of United Tractors (UNTR), PT Sumbawa Jutaraya, with an undisclosed transaction value. HRTA explained that the purpose of this cooperation is to develop the respective business activities of each party.

tickerNews.title: Bank Indonesia to Maintain Rupiah Stability Amid Weakening Exchange Rate
tickerNews.content: Executive Director of the Monetary Management and Securities Assets Department of Bank Indonesia, Erwin Gunawan Hutapea, told Bloomberg that the authority will maintain the stability of the Rupiah exchange rate through intervention in the spot forex market, bonds, and domestic and offshore NDFs. Erwin's statement came along with the weakening of the Rupiah against the US Dollar to the 16,490 level on Friday (8/29), marking the weakest level since August 1, 2025. Kompas also reported that the government postponed the monthly State Revenue and Expenditure Budget (APBN) presentation until September 3, 2025, and postponed the national coordination meeting for inflation control without providing a new schedule.

tickerNews.title: IDX to Implement Short Selling Transactions Starting September 29, 2025
tickerNews.content: IDX Director, Jeffrey Hendrik, stated on Friday (8/29) that the exchange will implement short selling transactions starting September 29, 2025. IDX has granted short selling financing permission to 2 exchange members, namely PT Ajaib Sekuritas Asia and PT Semesta Indovest Sekuritas.

tickerNews.title: Illegal Mines Crackdown Planned Starting September 1, 2025
tickerNews.content: Head of the Task Force for Forest Area Control, Febrie Adriansyah, stated that the task force plans to crack down on illegal mines starting September 1, 2025. Febrie estimates the area of these illegal mines reaches 4.27 million hectares. Subsequently, the mines confiscated by the Task Force will be temporarily handed over to the Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises for management.

tickerNews.title: NSSS Controlling Shareholder Sells 174.4 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: The controller of Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera (NSSS), PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama, sold approximately 174.4 million NSSS shares at an average price of 403.51 Rupiah per share on August 25, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 70.4 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership portion of PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama in NSSS decreased from 38.53% to 37.8%.

tickerNews.title: IMAS Subsidiary to Acquire 99.9% Stake in PT Nissan Motor Indonesia
tickerNews.content: Indomobil Sukses Internasional (IMAS) through its subsidiary, PT National Assemblers, signed a deed to acquire 99.9% of the shares of PT Nissan Motor Indonesia from Nissan Motor Co. Ltd. for an undisclosed value. This acquisition aims to enhance the group's business performance by adding its portfolio in the motorized vehicle assembly sector.
